intro: Scholtzia uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower scholtzia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in coastal and inland regions. It produces a single flower per stem, which blooms in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees. Scholtzia uniflora is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
